answers.answer: Hello dear,Is your husband hypertensive?You should monitor his blood pressure levela regularly ,was there any associated weakness?You should consult a neurologist and get  MRI done as there could be several causes TIA,migraine,stroke.degenerative spine changes,neuropathy,nerve compression etc.You should go for a evaluation and get the diagnosis confirmed.Best

I believe it could be associated with a migraine. I'm a 28 year old female. I just experienced blurred/spotted vision, followed by numbness in left hand, immediately followed by numbness on my lip and nose (left side), then was pounded with an awful headache. Miserable, but I think that could be it.

question: my husband is a 28 yo healthy male complaining of numbness in right hand, numb lips, face, and tongue with a headache as well, what could be causing this? He does have a family history of diabetes
title: numbness
